page.title: 19RAWLINGS FARM
page.content: 184 acres of grassland for silage, hay and grazing. This mixed animal farm has pedigree Charolais, Scimmintal, and Limousin for breeding, the same breeds are crossed for beef. Record price Charolais bull Â£28,000. The herd of 600 Suffolk cross-bred ewes produced 1025, fetching Â£40 each. Last year, 20 ewes died of pneumonia. The sheep are brought into the barns, with the help of the farm sheep-dog, on 18th December to be shorn 2 days later. There are 2 shears and 1 roller on the farm, and 500 sheep can be shorn in 2 days. Each fleece fetches about Â£3. A small flock of 7 rare breeds are kept for conservation. These are; 1 Jacab cow, 3 Lincoln Longwools, 2 Teeswater, 3 Herdwick, 11 Wensley- dales, and 3 Cotswolds - an old Roman breed. There are 3 regular farmers.
